TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class DbDataSource : IAsyncDisposable, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DbDataSource extends System.Object implements class System.IAsyncDisposable, class System.IDisposable
Public MustInherit Class DbDataSource Implements IAsyncDisposable, IDisposable
type DbDataSource = class interface IDisposable interface IAsyncDisposable
public ref class DbDataSource abstract : IAsyncDisposable, IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a data source which can be used to obtain open connections, and against which commands can be executed directly.
Docs.remarks: Unlike , which is purely a factory for provider-specific objects such as , hands out open connections to specific databases, encapsulating all the information needed to connect to a database. Depending on how the was configured, the connections it hands out may be pooled.

public: abstract property System::String ^ ConnectionString { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the connection string of the database represented by this . The exact contents of the connection string depend on the specific data source for this connection.
Docs.value: The connection string of the database represented by this . The exact contents of the connection string depend on the specific data source for this connection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.Common.DbBatch CreateBatch() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a that's ready for execution against the .
Docs.returns: A that's ready for execution against the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Batches returned from this method are already configured to execute against their originating <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource>; their <xref:System.Data.Common.DbBatch.Connection%2A> does not need to be set, and doing so will throw an exception.
Since these batches have no explicitly-managed connection, it is not possible to use them with transactions, and trying to set <xref:System.Data.Common.DbBatch.Transaction%2A> will throw an exception. To use a transaction, get a connection from <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource.OpenConnection%2A> and create a command against it.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Commands returned from this method are already configured to execute against their originating <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource>; their <xref:System.Data.Common.DbCommand.Connection%2A> does not need to be set, and doing so will throw an exception.
Since these commands have no explicitly-managed connection, it is not possible to use them with transactions, and trying to set <xref:System.Data.Common.DbCommand.Transaction%2A> will throw an exception. To use a transaction, get a connection from <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource.OpenConnection%2A> and create a command against it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.Common.DbConnection CreateConnection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a new, closed connection to the database represented by this .
Docs.returns: A new, closed connection to the database represented by this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The connection must be opened before it can be used.
It is the responsibility of the caller to properly dispose the connection returned by this method. Failure to do so may result in a connection leak.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed
abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources asynchronously.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the current instance of <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource> represents a connection pool, disposing it should close all idle connections, and arrange for busy connections to be closed as soon as possible.

Protected Overridable Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)
abstract member Dispose : bool -> unit override this.Dispose : bool -> unit

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Called by the Dispose() and Finalize() methods to release the managed and unmanaged resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is meant to be overridden by implementing ADO.NET providers, and is not a user-facing API.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask DisposeAsync() cil managed
abstract member DisposeAsync : unit -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask override this.DisposeAsync : unit -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask

Docs.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources asynchronously.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous dispose operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the current instance of <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource> represents a connection pool, disposing it should close all idle connections, and arrange for busy connections to be closed as soon as possible.
This method stores in the task it returns all non-usage exceptions that the method's synchronous counterpart can throw. If an exception is stored into the returned task, that exception will be thrown when the task is awaited. Usage exceptions, such as <xref:System.ArgumentException>, are still thrown synchronously. For the stored exceptions, see the exceptions thrown by <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource.Dispose>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.Common.DbConnection OpenConnection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a new, open connection to the database represented by this .
Docs.returns: A new, open connection to the database represented by this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned connection is already open, and is ready for immediate use.
It is the responsibility of the caller to properly dispose the connection returned by this method. Failure to do so may result in a connection leak.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1<class System.Data.Common.DbConnection> OpenConnectionAsync(valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Function OpenConnectionAsync (Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As ValueTask(Of DbConnection)

Docs.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Asynchronously returns a new, open connection to the database represented by this .
Docs.returns: A new, open connection to the database represented by this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned connection is already open, and is ready for immediate use.
It is the responsibility of the caller to properly dispose the connection returned by this method. Failure to do so may result in a connection leak.
This method stores in the task it returns all non-usage exceptions that the method's synchronous counterpart can throw. If an exception is stored into the returned task, that exception will be thrown when the task is awaited. Usage exceptions, such as <xref:System.ArgumentException>, are still thrown synchronously. For the stored exceptions, see the exceptions thrown by <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource.OpenConnection>.

Docs.exception: The cancellation token was canceled. This exception is stored into the returned task.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is meant to be overridden by implementing ADO.NET providers, and is not a user-facing API.
This method stores in the task it returns all non-usage exceptions that the method's synchronous counterpart can throw. If an exception is stored into the returned task, that exception will be thrown when the task is awaited. Usage exceptions, such as <xref:System.ArgumentException>, are still thrown synchronously. For the stored exceptions, see the exceptions thrown by <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataSource.OpenDbConnection>.
